author: smartprogrammer
content: <@194432762315407360>  why are we closing https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9152 ? I find the arguments against it not strong enough and it makes sense. My understanding is it is up for discussion

author: smartprogrammer
content: even if we dont want to include it for devnet-5 that doesnt meant the suggestion is to be disregarded

author: .fjl
content: it's kind of what I meant on the call as well, that I'd be back about this

author: .fjl
content: most people were OK with my proposal, but reth had an objection

author: .fjl
content: postponing to devnet-6 also gives us time to think about it

author: smartprogrammer
content: im not sure there will be devnet-6

author: smartprogrammer
content: but would love to hear from <@&1070471163219824730> more

author: .fjl
content: I retracted my proposal on ACD because I don't want to hold up the devnet-5 process

author: .fjl
content: but also didn't fully understand the concern with 'authorization routing'

author: .fjl
content: it was mentioned by Roman on the call

author: .fjl
content: like, they want the chainID in the object because it helps with some internal routing thing

author: closer__
content: thanks for tagging. basically, the argument is that we are introducing a new primitive in the protocol and it provides 0 benefit to make it context dependent. authorizations can be generated and exchanged on their own, before they are ever bundled into one transaction. the closest analogy to this would be removing chain id from transaction object everywhere because the "blockchain" knows which chain id it has

author: smartprogrammer
content: But when those tuples are exchanged, the chainId can be exchanged along side them, maybe, the block size cost saving is worth it?

author: rjected
content: There are no savings on mainnet?

author: smartprogrammer
content: byte vs u256 ? there is for sure savings

author: lightclient
content: these end up looking the same for `0x01` on mainnet

author: smartprogrammer
content: ah, true. if we are talking strictly on mainnet. was thinking about all chains.

author: closer__
content: imo this is strictly a client storage implementation detail. if you want, you can encode the transactions that way
